website_summaries.verdict: The Lenovo IdeaPad Y580 is a robust desktop replacement laptop, displaying exceptional gaming and multimedia capabilities while packing a dazzling screen with 1080p resolution, a Blu-ray drive, and even a full-sized keyboard.

customer_reviews.title: Completely disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Continuously having issue with this system. I have had nothing but issues since starting to use this regularly. Barely outside owning for a year due to moving and constantly having problems with the system being extremely slow. Constantly showing 90%+ HDD usage making the system, yet again, extremely slow. No documentation available online to repair this is making it a nightmare. I have found multiple reviews and sources of users having this exact problem with no help being offered from Lenovo. I am severely disappointed in this laptop and hope that Lenovo is made aware.
customer_reviews.author: -Ducky-

customer_reviews.title: 860M video card is a great buy. I've had this for over a year
customer_reviews.text: For about 1k, 860M video card is a great buy. I've had this for over a year, everything works fine so far. My only regret is not getting one with an i7 from lenovo instead of the i5, but at the time shipping was going to take like 2~3 months. If you're getting the base model, I recommend you get an SSD, with harddrive copy software (you might run into problems extracting OEM key for win10 or upgrading to 10 otherwise.) I haven't noticed any blatant color offsets that plagued the forums for this product when this came out. This can handle upcoming new game releases with ease on High.
customer_reviews.author: Derpton

customer_reviews.title: The screen isn't as terrible as people think it is
customer_reviews.text: Laptop looks very gorgeous. The screen isn't as terrible as people think it is. With a few minutes calibrating the color. My second immediate gripe about this product is the backside of the screen, the top side of the laptop, and specifically it's propensity to retain your fingerprints. OVERALL: This product exceeded my expectations after spending7-10 hours of research before making the purchase. If your budget is around 700-1100$ for a mid-range 'gaming'/'multi-media' laptop with a MATTE screen (not glossy), this is the computer to get.
customer_reviews.author: AmendiolaOblangota

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the price
customer_reviews.text: At the time I bought it at least, it was the cheapest laptop with a gtx graphics card in it. And it performs great. After about a month of heavy usage, it has only ever crashed once (after starting up on half battery from a long hibernate). It runs all my games fantastic on high settings (Wildstar, Borderlands 2, Sims 4.) I never go below 40fps on anything.
customer_reviews.author: Daphne

customer_reviews.title: Good equipment hampered by bad software
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for $950. It can run Assassin's Creed 4, ARMA 3, and Planetside 2 at high settings. Seems reliable, I haven't had any problems. Bloatware IS an issue, it will take about an hour to clean off all the applications you won't use. Win8 would be my biggest complaint, because of the always-on gesture controls and initial bias towards an online user account. The screen can seem blurry at times, but never while browsing the web/watching movies/playing games.
customer_reviews.author: FredtheFailLord

customer_reviews.title: IT guy approved
customer_reviews.text: Well I got me this to replace an aging laptop and give me something I could game with as well, and I will say you will not find a better laptop in this price range then this one. I would recommend it time and time again, in fact I have. It plays everything I throw at it on highest settings, the fan vents towards the screen to keep it off your lap. The keyboard may warm up but even then it is not terribly bad. Just be careful on the hinges and it will last a good long time.
customer_reviews.author: Razius

customer_reviews.title: Great product, 5/5
customer_reviews.text: Although many have bashed the screen, I have had 0 issues with this laptop. I may have some extreme bias because I've recently updated from a much smaller, outdated product, but this laptop is well worth it. I have been able to play numerous games (Dota2, Hearthstone, even some WCIII ROC) with no spiking due to the laptop processors. (Terrible internet is a different story) The speaker quality is great and I've been able to download FL Studio and run everything with ease. Definitely worth the purchase. I have had 0 issues with the scree as well. :D
customer_reviews.author: Anonym.

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.text: Best bang for the buck I've seen yet. Bought in 10/14, and I did a lot of searching for comparable performance for the dollar. This beat everything I saw by a wide margin. The complaints about the viewing angle are partially accurate. It's to be expected with a laptop and doesn't detract from the value one bit in my opinion. I have been able to do everything I've wanted to throw at this laptop and more. I am very glad I had bought it when I had.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: The backlighted keyboard is nice, and the screen
customer_reviews.text: For such a small system, it packs a serious punch. I can run Battlefield 3 on Ultra settings with around 30-55 fps. It doesn't run too hot, and the price you pay for the NVIDIA 860M and i5 processor is simply unheard of. The backlighted keyboard is nice, and the screen, while a bit small for my liking, provides great resolution. The only real downsides are that it doesn't have a DVD-ROM drive, and that it comes with Windows 8 pre-installed. Other than that, I'd say its definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Ibn Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great laptop for anything you need
customer_reviews.text: I'm completely satisfied with this laptop. It completely replaced my old laptop as I use this for work (software development) as well as different gaming sessions. It may not run the latest games at the higher settings, but at least I wasn't expecting for it to be *that* good, and that's why it is my on-the-go replacement for my gaming desktop. Have not experienced a single issue with this laptop, and I use it pretty much all day, every single day.
customer_reviews.author: Erick Gómez

customer_reviews.title: Great laptop
customer_reviews.text: I've had this computer for about 2 months and so far, I'm very pleased with it. I upgraded to Windows 10 as soon as I could and that went seamlessly. The speed is great, I've had no problems and overall it was a great replacement for my 3 year old Sony Vaio.

customer_reviews.text: This laptop is absolutely amazing. The i5-4200H, GTX 860m, the screen, and overall design are all excellent. I have not encountered a game that I can't play smoothly on ultra settings (Alien Isolation, BF4, WoW, Sims 4, Civilization beyond earth, Shadows of Mordor). Some of the complaints below are unwarranted IMO, this machine is currently under $900 and for that price, you are getting a BEAST of a gaming laptop. I really couldn't be happier.

The hdd is the one thing on this that is not perfect as a ssd would be much faster But $900 is $900 and for $900 this thing is worth it.

Unfortunately, the screen is so horrifically bad I cannot even imaging looking at it for 5 minutes, much less the next few years.
